derivation: from the same as H98 (אֲגַם); a marshy pool (others from a different root, a kettle); by implication
outline:
1. rush, bulrush
    1. used as cord or line (of twisted rushes or spun of rush fibre)
    2. of the lowly, insignificant (metaph)
  2. sad, drooping
    1. of line of bulrushes
    2. bowing of the head (fig.)
    3. of the lowly (metaph)
strongs_def: a bulrush (as growing there); collectively a rope of bulrushes
